lines.text: It's a way station. The last one. Then the United States.
lines.character: Peter Karczag INS aka Josef Gombush

lines.text: Is it everything people dream about?
I don't know. It is what many have dreamed. Others whose dreams have edges too round, colors too bright, they are disappointed.
lines.character: Peter Karczag INS aka Josef Gombush

lines.text: Oh, I'm not looking for streets paved with gold. A home, respect, freedom. And neighbors who want the same thing.
Marianne, don't hope for too much.
lines.character: Peter Karczag INS aka Josef Gombush

lines.text: Even if things go as you expect, I've been to the United States... a little thing like an accent, a foreign name, it will set you apart. There's always someone who laughs.
lines.character: Peter Karczag INS aka Josef Gombush

lines.text: A shrewd man never asks questions until he has gathered enough information to be able to distinguish between lies and truth.
